metadata.title: CVE-2022-48961 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: mdio: fix unbalanced fwnode reference count in mdio_device_release()There is warning report about of_node refcount leakwhile probing mdio device:OF: ERROR: memory leak, expected refcount 1 instead of 2,of_node_get()/of_node_put() unbalanced - destroy cset entry:attach overlay node /spi/soc@0/mdio@710700c0/ethernet@4In of_mdiobus_register_device(), we increase fwnode refcountby fwnode_handle_get() before associating the of_node withmdio device, but it has never been decreased in normal path.Since that, in mdio_device_release(), it needs to callfwnode_handle_put() in addition instead of calling kfree()directly.After above, just calling mdio_device_free() in the error handlepath of of_mdiobus_register_device() is enough to keep therefcount balanced.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48961` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
